translation: Sattva attaches to happiness, Rajas to action, O Arjuna, while Tamas, verily shrouding knowledge, attaches to heedlessness.
commentary: 14.9 Sattvam purity? Sukhe to happiness? Sanjayati attaches? Rajah active force? in action to action? India Or Bharata? Knowledge knowledge? Frequency shrouding? You verily? Darkness inertia? Pramade to heedlessness? Sanjayati attaches? Ut but.Commentary Just as a dark cloud enshrouds the sun? so also Tamas envelopes knowledge or the light of the Self. Does Tamas create an attachment for heedlessness? that is? ignorance or forgetfulness of duty or the nonperformance of necessary (obligatory) duties.
